author: Steve Robson
title: First picture of boy, 16, 'stabbed in heart' on way home from school in attack 'caught on camera'
text:
News First picture of boy, 16, 'stabbed in heart' on way home from school in attack 'caught on camera' The victim has been named locally as a 16-year-old boy called Irfan Fazil - known as Iffy to friends - who was reportedly 'knifed' after getting off a bus Share By Steve Robson Stephen Jones 15:59, 11 FEB 2017 The 16-year-old boy stabbed to death in Leeds has been named as Irfan Fazil - son of Waheid - known as Iffy to friends (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
This is the first picture of the tragic boy stabbed to death on his way home from school in Leeds. 
The victim has been named by relatives as a 16-year-old boy called Irfan Fazil - son of Waheid Fazil - known as Iffy to his friends. 
Tributes posted online describe him as a "good lad" who had "a bright future ahead of him". 
Launching a murder inquiry, police said the attack may have been caught on film - as Irfan's devastated uncle Tahir Fazil said his nephew was "brutally stabbed... in the heart". 
Tahir Fazil posted on Facebook: "Not easy for us at this time not a nice way to watch a son/brother/friend/nephew to go." 
Friends are organising a 'Dua' - a prayer vigil - at the local Bilal Mosque today when people of all faiths are being invited to "show love and respect" for Irfan. 
A close family friend, Mohammed Ilyas, 39, who works for the Home Office, told MirrorOnline that "everyone loved" Irfan. 
"He was a funny guy. He'd always find a minutes to talk to you. He was there for everyone," he added. 
The tragic incident occurred on a busy street in Leeds just after school finished at 3.42pm on Friday - after pupils had broken up for half-term holidays. 
Police were called to a stabbing and discovered Iffy lying injured at the scene on Harehills Lane in Leeds. The scene in Leeds where Iffy was stabbed to death (Photo: Mark Readman) 
He was rushed to hospital but died a short time later. His family are understood to be waiting for his body to be released by the coroner for burial after a post-mortem is carried out. 
West Yorkshire Police have launched a murder inquiry and have arrested a 15-year-old boy. 
He remains in custody after being held overnight for questioning on suspicion of murder. 
Last night one of Irfan's best friends posted online: "No words can explain.. us 2 were brothers. 
"He was humble and loyal and my close boy. 
"My brother no matter what. The love will never go. Always in my heart." Police have arrested a 15-year-old boy on suspicion of murder (Photo: Mark Readman) 
Dozens of family and friends took to social media to pay tribute to Iffy as news of the tragedy filtered through the local community. 
Posting a picture of smiling Iffy, Abid Kotia wrote: "So sad on this sad news of this 16-yr-old Irfan his has died in a stabbing on harehills Lane Compton.... just left school and caught bus home.... prayers for his family another life lost". 
Shaista Khan commented: "He was a good lad had a bright future ahead of him. 
"So sad and heart felt condolences to the family." The stabbing happened shortly after local schools finished for half-term on Friday (Photo: Mark Readman) 
A fellow pupil at Carr Manor Community School added: "Rest In Peace brother man is going to miss you like mad". 
Another friend Cheyanne wrote on Facebook: "RIP Iffy. Taken way too soon". 
Detective Superintendent Pat Twiggs appealed for anyone who witnessed the event to come forward. 
He said: "This tragic incident happened in a busy area at a busy time of day with large numbers of people going about their daily business. 
"I am appealing directly to anyone who witnessed the incident or has information that could help our enquiries to come forward. 
"We are particularly keen to speak to anyone who witnessed anyone running in the area to come forward. 
"It is also possible that people may have recorded footage on their mobile phones and I would again encourage those people to come forward." 
Anyone with information should ring the police on 101 regarding log 1017 of 10th or ring Crimestoppers on 0800 555111. Like us on Facebook
